p: Currently, the species covers more than 2.5 million ha of land. Portugal is the largest European chestnut producer by area (ha) and Spain is the largest European chestnut producer by quantity (t) ( Table 1) [ 3, 14]. Moreover, Spain is the country with the highest productivity (>5 t ha −1), while Portugal and France show the lowest productivity values (<1 t ha −1) ( Table 1). This low productivity is can be explained by aged orchards and many isolated trees.
